info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 6 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman OK has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Salt Fork Arkansas River at Tonkawa affecting Kay, Noble and Grant Counties.
Cimarron River near Waynoka affecting Woodward, Major and Woods Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Cimarron River near Waynoka.
* WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Expect shallow flooding of agricultural lands along the river. Some fields may be isolated by deep flows in cutoff channels meandering across the flood plain. The river reach affected extends from near Freedom upstream... to the U.S. Highway 281 crossing south of Little Sahara State Park near Waynoka... to near Orienta in Major County.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Friday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this afternoon to 8.8 feet this evening. It will then fall tomorrow morning. It will rise to 9.3 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall Sunday morning. It will rise to 9.3 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY

area.areaDesc: Major, OK; Woods, OK; Woodward, OK
